head.title: Don't Let New York Take The Fun Out of Dating

hedline.hl1: Don't Let New York Take The Fun Out of Dating

block.p: Instead of all the personal ads, matchmaking services and other businesses designed to help find a loved one -- described on Feb. 13 in "Desperately Seeking Someone?" -- New Yorkers should find a solution that relies not on money but on the human spirit.

Instead of all the personal ads, matchmaking services and other businesses designed to help find a loved one -- described on Feb. 13 in "Desperately Seeking Someone?" -- New Yorkers should find a solution that relies not on money but on the human spirit.
Yes, New York is a formidable place to live. Crime and con games are as common as night and day. Men and women must work hard to live. But we shouldn't let New York take the fun out of dating.

Dating should be relaxed and spontaneous, not efficient and businesslike. All these matchmaking services only serve to cover up the real problem: ourselves. We've become too cruel and cynical toward one another. We say we don't have enough time because of our work so we try to take away the pains and joys of romance by throwing money at the problem.

Work will never be a substitute for caring about someone. Dating services are not the answer. Join organizations with a cause. Eventually you may meet a soulmate to spend the rest of your life with. JOHN WANG The Bronx
